about.name: MICAELA DELMONTE
about.title: UIãƒ»Graphic Designer | Frontend Developer
about.content: I am a UI Designer, Frontend Developer, and Graphic Designer. I aim to create and provide designs that are visually pleasing and informative at the same time. I am always eager to learn new things from the experiences I accumulate through working with different people and different projects. With my current skills, I will work hard to provide good services while exerting efforts and enjoying what I am doing.

skills.name: UI Design
skills.description: Knowledge and experience in designing user interfaces using wireframing and prototyping tools/softwares.

skills.name: Frontend Development
skills.description: Knowledge and experience in frontend development using various frameworks, but mainly PHP and JavaScript frameworks.

skills.name: Graphic Design
skills.description: Knowledge and experience in designing posters, logos, pamphlets, etc. using various editing software of Adobe.

works.title: OKUTARA
works.subtitle: A blogging inbound website that showcases the experiences of travelers who traveled to Okutama, Tokyo
works.description: Okutara is an inbound tourism website for Okutama, Japan. This system is a project created for our Japanese class in Okutama Japanese Language School (Also Bridge Institute of Technology). It uses the PHP framework Laravel.
works.note: Github repository is undisclosed due to privacy settings. Link will be updated once project is published.

works.title: Babel Method
works.subtitle: A Japanese E-Learning system for foreign employees of Jellyfish Inc.
works.description: Babel Method is a Japanese Language E-Learning system designed to cater to international employees. It is an in-house language learning system for foreigners working in the company. The system uses the VueJS framework for frontend and NodeJS for backend.
works.note: Github repository is undisclosed due to privacy settings. Link will be updated once project is published.

works.title: Spring Term Final Presentation: List of Projects Pamphlet
works.subtitle: A pamphlet design for the list of projects to be presented during the spring final term presentation in Bridge Institute of Technology
works.description: The Okutama Japanese Language School hosts a presentation where the town people of Okutama is invited to listen and give feedbacks to the different projects created and presented by the students. This pamphlet shows the list of projects presented on the day of the presentation so that the audience will know the basic details of the projects.
works.note: Github unavailable because it is a graphic design project.

works.title: Okutama Kodomo Daisakusen Recruitment Pamphlet
works.subtitle: A pamphlet design for the recruitment of members for the Okutama Kodomo Daisakusen event in Okutama, Tokyo
works.description: The goal of the pamphlet is to recruit members from Tokyo Denki University who may be willing to participate in hosting and facilitating the event in Okutama, called the Okutama Kodomo Daisakusen.
works.note: Github unavailable because it is a graphic design project.

works.title: DNUS
works.subtitle: Online recruitment service for companies who want to hire foreigners in Japan.
works.description: DNUS is a service owned by DOC Inc. It is a recruitment system for foreigners who may be interested to work in Japan. This system used Ruby on Rails PHP framework.
works.languages: PHP (Ruby on Rails), HTML (HAML), CSS (SASS), Javascript/CoffeeScript, MySQL
works.note: Github repository is undisclosed due to privacy settings.

works.title: Online Resort Reservation and Billing System
works.subtitle: Web-based online reservation and billing system for Rio Villa Nuevo Mineral Water Resort in Indang, Cavite, Philippines
works.description: Rio Villa Nuevo Mineral Water Resort is a resort in Indang, Cavite, Philippines. The system created for this company consisted of an online reservation and billing system for the guests, as well as management of reservation, payment, and generation of reports for the administration. This system was created in order to help the company ease from their manual management to a more systemated way of handling resort data. In addition to the reservation and billing modules, the system also allows the company to manage the information being displayed in the website.
works.role: UI Designer / Frontend developer / Project leader
works.note: Website link unavailable due to expiry of domain.
